description: loved it.  great service, great food, great vibe.  friendly and no hipster-attitude in sight.
author: carol d.

description:
Nice restaurant in a nice neighboor,
I read the review in Sfchronicle and I decided to come here,
the atmosphear in the restaurant was very intimate and warm, we had a window table and it was possible to see the 18th street...and at the same time there was a  funny italian movie from 60's
Ok let's start with the food, I ask a recomendation to the waiter, very friendly and patient italian guy, who explain with total detail all ours question, about ingredients, how they cook... so we order three appetizer, first the carpaccio di manzo, no words about this dish you should come here and taste... second one tortino ai carciofi, excelent and original dish fried antichokecake with mozzarella and the third one was the gnocchi, big surprise when I tasted the gnocchi, I never tasted something similar awesome dish!!
After that we shared home made Tortelloni, with riccota cheese and prosciutto... the pasta was perfect cooked and the sauce was simply incredible.
how can I eat all this dishes? simple they have a home made digestives and we drinked between the dishes, bay leaves digestive and fennel digestive had a very good taste.
After appetizer, tortelloni and shots of digestives I had the fillet mingon in a red wine sauce, we follow the council of our waiter, it was cook rare... incredible!!! it was like a butter it was tender and tasty. My girlfriend order chicken with lemon sauce, very tasty!!
Dessert we shared a pear in red wine with vanilla ice cream... it was a perfect end for our dinning experience in poesia.
Cocktails and wine, we drinked an excepcional seasonal and fresh ingredients cocktail before the dinner, the bartender was an Italian guy who explain with all deatils the ingredients  and after that he come to our table to explain the better wine for our dishes, we ordered the amarone Valpollicella very good wine.
I want to be grateful to Poesia staff for the one of the best dinner experiences I ever had, Thank's!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Frederick S.

description: What can I say but FANTASTIC!!! The staff opened up early for us ( a party of 17) and treated us like we were all guests at their house. It was a really great experience. Food, very good to great, Service, as good as it gets! Thank you all for a wonderful night!!!!
author: Dr. William B.

description: This place has such a cute, cozy feel to it. You really do feel like you're eating in someone's living room.  Everything we had was tasty, although a little heavy on the olive oil.  If ordering a salad, opt for the endive rather than the arugula, which as relatively unexciting.  The service was attentive and friendly, and overall the restaurant seems to be a winner. The wine list is a bit short on inexpensive choices though. I always appreciate when there are more than a few of choices in the 30 to 40 dollar range.
author: SL N.

description:
no, no, this is not seriously good.
this is just an OK restaurant.
do not expect more or less.
using so-so good olive oil, so why don't they just make more simple ones?
please do not hold a candle to the sun.
don't chose gnocchi, the sauce is just a mixture of butter and orange juice. weird.
and chocolate mouse with olive oil and chili was good but too tiny.
sea food spaghetti was the only satisfiable one today but the tomato sauce should have been more caramelized.
author: Yoshi m.

description: Amazing experience! From the ambiance, to the delicious menu and presentation the friendly service to Francesco speaking with everyone in the restaurant, I have already been back w/friends five times! Mattea, at the bar, starts off a great Italian evening! This restaurant will do very well, and is overdue in the Castro!
author: Garret M.

description: Haha...I have such good memories of this place. I tried this place with my girlfriends. We tried the seafood ravioli, pork spare ribs and the special which was duck pasta I think. My favorite were the spare ribs. The meat just melted off the bone. The server also helped us pair a very nice white wine to go with our meal. The food was a bit pricey, but all the servers were really attentive and helped add to the great experience. I took off one star for price and the 5 rounds it took me to find parking.
author: Erin T.

description:
My first visit to Poesia and with high expectations...great reviews about the wonderfull Italian staff. and great Italian regional food brought us here.  We had been to this restaurant many years ago when it was  a great French Style bistro

  This was a most dissapointing dinner i have had in ages.  We were greeted and seated promptly and then the quality went down hill. The ridiculous stingiest bread basket i have ever seen, would make any respectable Italian Trattoria blush. We were looking for a great meal and this restaurant is not the place to find it.

   We found this restaurant through Living Social..A 3 course meal including  two glasses of wine , for two people, When we arrived we were directed to choose only from the HOUSE WINE  Red, White or Rose'..The offering almost like receiving a stingy wine tastig.  We were allowed to select the soup instead of desert which was very nice, since neither of us ate sweets. The soup a Tomato bread soup was nicely presented but poorly executed..tasted terrible...like eating tomato cardboard. for the next course  my partner ordered Mussels...He swears   the sauce accompaniment tasted like tomato paste and after tasting it i totally agree...ugh. My brasoalla was like eating yesterdays roast.   NOW for the secondi or entree OMG  for $26 my partners Filet Mignon could NOT have weighed in more the 3 ounces...give me a break... My so called Sea Bass was tasteless and boring. it was not prepared in Olive Oil as my server had guaranteed.  It was obviolsly cooked in heavy vegetable oil which i am totally opposed to. The kitchen obviously NOT Italian and it really shows.


   We ordered a second glass of wine and mysteriously  it became a different offering of different quantity.   If this is all livingsocial has to  offer ....nothing close to the actaual price offering  Terrible food.....if anyone likes this stuff.....then you have never eaten Italian Food.
author: Ross V.

description: Found this place on a whim when I was at The Mix and it was a great find! We had some awesome dishes and the setting was cool. The service was a little bit slow and our grilled calamari had a SLIGHTLY chared flavor to it (but still not rubbery). The beef  carpaccio was AMAZING and so was the braised lamb pasta. Overall the minor problems were GREATLY outnumbered by them doing a great job, I will definetly return!
author: DC S.

description:
Poesia was a big disappointment.  First the menu is very limited.  At first glance I almost walked out - they offer 5 options and the only meat was a steak.  Though I soon noticed they had 'Specials' so decided to stay.  BTW  "Specials" should be interpreted as "Special Pricing - So Special we will surprise you when the check comes".
On the positive the service is will executed.  Better then many restaurants in SF.  At the bar the bartender allows you to taste the wine before filling your glass.  Nice touch.  But it quickly falls apart from there.
1) Mixed Greens:  I thought this was a typical mixed greens salad...  Turns out it was a tiny "salad" resting on what most people call an Onion Ring.  Same old,  pre-battered,  Pre-frozen  onion ring from Sysico Foods Dist.   Tossed in the deep-fry.  Great on burgers - meanwhile Italians cringe.  I should have sent it back.

2) Rack of Lamb:  Now I make rack of lamb all the time and order it at many restaurants.  Its good stuff.   At Poesia they cover it with some brown creamy stuff.  While it was cooked properly, it was totally un-seasoned!  No salt, no pepper, no rosemary, no mustard, no garlic.  (To those who love lamb..  Simply stick garlic, and rosemary in the meat, smear mustard all over it, salt the fat, and roast.  Never can go wrong).  Poorly executed and waste of good meat.  Special price of $33!!

3) Risotto:  Give me a F-ing break.  I love Risotto, cook it all the time.  Its simple, simple simple,  and cheap. Learn how to make it and impress your friends.  Risotto is the profit centers of any restaurants.  Its hard to spend more then 4$ for the ingredients so charging $13 + is a no brainer.   At Poesia it was $23 and was about  1 cup of cooked rice.   Another "Special" apparently.

End of the night:  4 glasses of wine (mid-range) 2 salads, 1 Lamb, 1 risotto  (note:  no appetizer nor desert)  Total $122.00.  I left feeling ripped off!  Earlier that week I had dinner at Boulevard with business clients and the check was actually less!  Never again. 

The server uped the star rating to 2...  otherwise it would be a 1
author: David C.

description:
Just discovered this place last weekend. The place is very nice: a typical SF Victorian house turned into a restaurant with a cozy feel. A movie was projected on one of the walls (we discovered later that there was a birthday party for one of the actors in the movie a few tables away). The staff was nice and helpful, suggested some changes on our orders, which we didn't regret. They were also helpful with the wine choice. The food was delicious and tasted very fresh. .It ended up being $60 per person but we really treated ourselves: 3-course dinner+before-dinner drink+wine.
As always this being the Castro, parking is terrible so do what you can to not need it.
author: Matthieu L.

description: I made a reservation for me and my Partner to celebrate his 44th birthday. We were the first to arrive at the restaurant at 5:30pm and asked for the seat by the window. After ordering a drink and 2 appetizers, I noticed  there were gnats flying around the table. I tried to tolerate the situation until one gnat went into the food and one into my drink. The owner came over and I suggested fumigation and he became defensive and claimed they had fumigated that day and did I want to see the receipt. I told him that I am not going to argue with him. He then said the gnats were due to the rain and he had no control over it, did I want another drink? I told him that we were not staying for dinner. He then charged us for the drinks and appetizers and said 'sorry'. Anyway, if you go, I hope your experience is better than mine.
author: Lee J.

description:
my gf and i got the artichoke cakes to start and i took one bite and pushed it to her side of the table.  i didn't like the texture and it had no flavor.  yuck!  it's not often that i don't eat something.  

she got a pasta dish that was good and i had the gnocci starter and it was very good.  the problem was that it cost $14 and was about 4 bites of food.  for steak, ok, for gnocci nope.  i went to e tutto qua tonight and got the gnocci and it tsted just as good and was the same price but 4 times the amount.

lastly the service was ridiculous.  for my taste they were way too much.  we were treated well and they were friendly but our waiter was way to chatty and we could hardly have a private conversation because one of three people came to our table every 2 minutes.  when we left i told my gf i must have said thank u 20 times (no embellishment) during dinner.  i didn't like the ambiance.  granted we were 1 of 3 sets of people in the resto so maybe they would lay off if there were more people to bother.

go to north beach and get some good italion food for a sane price, not here.
author: Mick M.

description:
5 Stars! More Fun! Poesia! 

We came here for my bf's birthday. I play in a basketball league on Tuesday nights at the Eureka Valley Community Center which is only about a block away. I made reservations at 4:30 Tuesday for 7:00 that night.  I work in San Jose so I was worrying about two things: 1. Making sure we got to the restaurant on time and 2. Making sure we ate fast enough so our stomachs had a little time to rest for our 8:30 game. Once we got to the restaurant we ordered and I told the waitress that we had a game so she made sure to take a note of that. Our food came out with perfect timing. We started with a Bruschetta. It was fantastic, plus I love bruschetta. Then my boyfriend had the salad with romaine lettuce and Gorgonzola dressing.   It was pretty good. Very cheesy. Now to the entrees'. We all got pasta. My boyfriend and our friend ordered the special which was a parpadelle pasta with a red meat sauce. I got the Fileji  pasta with a red sauce and pork ribs. SOOO GOOD! All the pasta is homemade. The bus guy told us they come there early to make it. Yummie.. The pasta had a perfect chew. We were too full for dessert and had to head off to our game. We'll have to try it next time. 

I will definitely try to come back. I left that place with a big smile!
author: Courtney Y.

description:
Poesia
Castro area
Food 3
Service 5
Ambiance/Decor 4
---
Food 3
-Rack of lamb
Super gamey, white wine crm sauce didn't go well brought out gameyness (i normally order a lot of lamb and don't mind a bit of the gamey taste, but this was too much)
-Filet mignon
Tender but overcooked, sliced up is a no no, flavor blah
-Swordfish w homemade pasta
Came out all chopped up and messy, fish not tasty, only homemade pasta was good
-pork tenderlion
Overcooked, dry, no flavor, sauce blah
-carpaccio
Chewy and limey, i expected it to be more tender.
-caprese
Good fresh mozz
-endive salad walnut apples
Can't mess up
-panna cotta chocolate mousse w sea salt
Nothing special
---
Service 5
Luigi--Was the only great thing that made our dinner fun and special
He really knows how to sell the dishes to ya
Funny personable friendly and attentive service
---
Ambience/Decor 4
Cute victorian home turned restaurant
Therefore small and cozy
Simple modern decor
author: Lily V.

description: I ordered the pork ragout with pasta.  I couldn't eat most of it because of all the fat.  Maybe this is typical in Italy, but I found all the fat disgusting and therefore most of the meal was inedible.  The menu was overpriced and the food was average.  I liked the inside though.
author: Jane L.

description:
the place is too small to go to during busy hours. We were cramped in the corner and if you are claustrophobic, this isn't really a good place for you. The waiters were friendly, but our food took too long and it arrived luke-warm. 
All the pastas we had were undercooked as well and the mushroom pasta with artichoke was too salty. I dont think I would come here again.
author: Nancy Y.

description:
I'd heard amazing things about Poesia from many people, but I must have been there on an off night.  The food was good, but a bit too drenched in olive oil.  The olive oil was good, it's just that it overwhelmed the other flavors. Also, the service was very spotty... we didn't get a lot of attention, but when there was someone at our table, they really took it over, with servers aggressively interrupting conversations and leaning over the table, etc.  

I'll try it again soon to see if I have a better experience.
author: Adam C.

description: The service was great! The food was excellent. I really like the atmosphere here. Nice touch- the owner was at the door to greet people as they entered.
author: Jon R.

description: this place sucked. the service was good, but the food was bland and not worth the price at all. if i paid $7 for the pasta i still would have been unhappy.
author: Jenny B.

description:
Every single time I go to Poesia I have an amazing dining experience.

First of all, the staff are always pleasant and happy.

Secondly, every dish I try I find to be exceptional with amazing flavors and textures.

I have recently begun to try to lose weight so I was a little anxious to go to Poesia.  Let me tell you, since I am on a low carb regimen, I found I could be satisfied at this restaurant and then some.

I started with the tomato soup.  Nice and thick with just the right amount of cheese.  Perfect for a cold San Francisco evening.

From there, I had the Lemony Chicken.  

Folks, I do not know how they did it, but it really was the most delicious I have ever had...period.  Since I did not want potatoes they added a delicious sauteed broccoli rabe which was just perfect.

It killed me not to have my favorite dessert...alas I had to forego the chocolate mousse with olive oil, rock salt and chili....how do you think I got in my predicament in the first place.

Prices are reasonable, however, make sure you have reservations.

This used to be a cursed location...not any more.

I like the atmosphere and interior and can guarantee I will be back often.
author: Eli B.

description: I found the service here to be quite good, the staff friendly and the food good.  But I must emphasize the "good" not excellent of the food.  We started with the zuccini carpacio which was fresh and light, but there wasn't enough truffle oil, or perhaps it needed more salt and pepper, some bites were, well just zuccini. We then moved onto the special scallop pasta. This was also quite *good* but again not amazing.  I really feel like this place has potential so I will be back and perhaps I just ordered the wrong items?  All in all it was a solid meal and I will note that the servers are very nice and very helpful.  Perhaps with a little more time and marinating....
author: Claire C.

description:
omg this place is gooooood! i thought i'd at least heard of all the places worth going to in the city, so this came as a complete surprise.

FOOD:~eggplant parmigiana was f-ing good. so light & miraculous.

~tagliatelle was solid, just as good as chez panisse's simple pasta, in my opinion.

~sardines: holy crap, these were so good, so fishy, the right amount of oil, & the right amount of ocean.

SERVICE: was good, but i felt a little overlooked. we had a large party, so i understand, but i demand attention!

DECOR: ok

BATHROOM: ok

OVERALL: i'd go back & show italian food-lovers this place for sure.
author: miss b.

description:
Beautiful, Romantic place with Great drinks!! We tried the Basil/Vodka cocktail and the Fennel/Vodka cocktail and they were both delicious!!! The mango one was great until we tried the Basil one. The appetizer was delicious but my main pasta dish was just ok. I had the tortellini with eggplant and burrata cheese and just something about that mix that didn't work for me. The other two dishes on our table were Farfalle with Scallops and Zucchini special and my friends seemed to enjoy the dishes. Chocolate moose with chilli pepper and Mascarpone got devoured quickly too.

Service here is amazing!  Our waiter was also the bartender for the drinks and he was just a pleasure to talk to.
author: Anu Y.

description: I'm not sure what all the fuss is about.  Sweet place, funky entrance / waiting area, too congested.  Service attentive and knowledgeable.  Free fried fish or smelt nice touch for a starter.  Shared a mixed beet salad which was lovely and very fresh and plentiful.  Also a Calamari dish which was quite tasty.  Moving on to the pasta choices honestly nothing to write home about.  My friend had Eggplant Parm which had a nice rich sauce but skimpiest of portion.  Another had a lamb dish which he thoroughly enjoyed.  I had a pasta dish with Pork (name escapes me) and sadly it was luke warm but they were gracious enough to re-heat it.  It was difficult to eat though because of all the pork bones and gristle, a bit of a turn off. Generous portion.  They did keep the bread coming to soak up the sauces which was nice and the olive oil very fresh.  Dessert was a chocolate mousse plate, tiny dollops of mousse which was tasty but skimpy.  For the price and the quality of the food overall I won't be returning.  I so wanted to love this place, but frankly there are so many wonderful Italian restaurants in this town, I'll be dining elsewhere.  Best of luck to them and I hope they can survive.
author: Marla B.

description:
Last evening was my third visit to Poesia and today I had to sit down and write a review. 
I love this place, from the wonderful and friendly wait staff, the atmosphere, and of course the food. 
My 3 friends all had the Pork ribs with the homemade pasta on my recommendation and they LOVED it. I tried the eggplant Parmesan and it was so good and so creamy I'm going to get that again next visit. 
The waiter was wonderful at suggesting and bringing a wonderful Italian wine that we all enjoyed and we did have the chocolate mousse with the rock salt and olive oil which is heaven. 
I totally recommend Poesia for a reasonably priced and fabulous dinner!
author: Richelle D.

description: Fine dinning in the Castro...?!!!  I know just as surprised as the next queen. Love this place, usually don't think of the Castro as the place i want to go for a nice dinner out with the lover, friends, family, but Poesia totally is the spot!!  Enjoy clean, tasty, fresh food that is casual but upscale, and does not have you leaving hungry or wishing that you ordered something different. They really have raised the bar for what dinning out in the Castro looks like and love them for that, no longer just pizza or a burger!  They also have a great bar with fun drinks and service the last few time been there has been amazing!! Love the home like feel and really feels like eating dinner at a friends house!
author: Danny B.

description:
Terrific spot, worth seeking out.  Amazing pastas and antipasti.
I had some of the best gnocchi I have ever tasted.  Service was friendly and warm.  The place is just a gem.  They know food and they know wine, without an ounce of pretension.  I will go back.
author: Meg M.

description: They are off to a rough, but promising start.  The food was, overall, worth returning for.  The wait staff is still in learning mode, but they show signs of progress.  I'll return in a few months after the kinks have been worked out.  Hopefully, they'll still be open, as every restaurant to ever occupy this space has gone under.
author: C. W.

description:
Fabulous service, great food and an overall great experience.

The Italian bar tender dedicated a great deal of time to ensure we found the wine we liked, which is very unusual even in some of the top restaurants in the city. He was happy to keep opening bottles to have us taste the wine before ordering the bottle.

I was pleasantly surprised by the halibut. It was quite hot, which made the meal all the more enjoyable.

Francesco, the owner, would go around greeting people and answering questions, which is very European and a great way to build a solid clientelle based on a sense of trust and willingness to return there.

Bitter Rice was projected on the big wall while dining. Fabrics will soon divide the place so that the noise level will decrease.

Good luck guys!
author: Nena G.

description: the gnocchi antipast with citrus sauce and cherry tomatoes is PHENOMENAL!
author: Bren B.

description: We made a last minute reservation and were assured we would get a round table in a quieter corner for the four of us. We waited for an hour when we saw another party being led to the table we thought we were waiting for. When asked what happened, the owner told us they had a party of five and this is the only table which would accommodate the number of guests. We continued waiting, hungry and thirsty. We ordered a bottle of wine to have a few sips while waiting. After about an hour an 20 minutes of wait, we were led to a table for four, it was right in front of the entry door. The food was fine, but frankly, nobody in our party enjoyed it after all this time of waiting. Nothing was done as a comp for the wait, or having to sit at the worst table in the restaurant. My husband and I just moved to the neighborhood (three blocks from the restaurant), we brought two friends from out old area in the East Bay and we were all very disappointed with the reception and service. It will be a while before we give this another try.
author: Emily Z.

description:
Ate here tonight with a Groupon I got for my b-day. They do pack people in there. Filled up even on a Wednesday night. I had to move seats b/c the movie was right at my head and made me dizzy! 
First, I'm not a wine drinker, but if i do have some, it has to be white and not dry. Otherwise it gives me a headache and hurts my teeth. I asked for a sweetish, fruity white. Server suggested a pinot grigio. I agreed. he then brought me a Sauvignon Blanc, which I don't like. He said the bartender said it better matched what I was looking for. I tasted it and did not like it at all. I said i didn't like it. Server told me it would be okay with my food and walked off! 
However, when he came back, he said I could get something else if I wanted. I got their special- blood orange cosmo. That was bitter but tasty. 
Food: Tomato bread soup, Fettuccine w/lamb, salted cod cake thing, corkscrew pasta with pork. 
The bread is fantastic. Not crunchy crusted Italian style, but a soft, super- dense bread that I couldn't stop eating. We had 3 baskets. Yep. 
The soup was good. Very tomatoey. Reminiscent of eating pasta sauce with a spoon. The bread is soaked in the tomato, making it indiscernible from chunks of tomatoes. I liked it, as did my friend, but not for the price. 
My friend's cod/potato starter was basically a cod cake. I love sardines and other fishy-fish, but this thing was too salty and too fishy for what it was. He liked it. I thought it was like a sardine croquette. 
All the food was served on oversize dishes. I like ALOT of food, so not a big fan of big dishes that make food look small. 
Except for the soup. all dishes had lines of pesto or something similar piped around for decorative effect. 
It was probably a 1/2 hour between starters and when our pasta arrived. Lamb fettuccine: Love the pasta, homemade, chewy, dense. This dish was quite gamey. Some small pieces of lamb. A chunk of fat! REALLY needed salt, which we did not have on the table. It was good. Not great. 
Corkscrew pasta w/ pork: I liked it, but it was my friend's order. And it wasn't corkscrew, it was ziti (tubes). Homemade as well, and very thick and chewy. I like doughy, but this was too much even for me. Friend commented later that he thought the pasta was too thick. There were a couple largish chunks of pork, though one was mostly bone. It was tasty and didn't need salt. Seemed similar to the lamb pasta, but not as gamey. 
All in all, the food and service was good. Yes, the staff is easy on the eyes, and very friendly. But to me the wait between starter and main course (pasta here) was too long, and the food too small and under seasoned for the price. 
Without a Groupon would've felt ripped off. For the above with 1 glass of wine and 1 cocktail (they charged me for the cost of the wine, which I suspect is higher than the cocktail special, but I may be mistaken), = $70. We both agreed food as good or better can be found elsewhere for less.
author: Allucaneat G.

description: I have heard so many wonderful things about this place.  After a long and overdue wait, I decided to take my Italian friend there for dinner.  First off, they asked him if he were Italian, after he was already speaking the language.  No offense, but really?  Then, I sat down to order a drink that was a specific drink.  I did not get my cocktail.  Instead, I got a totally different drink, that wasn't bad, just not at all what I ordered.  The service was very good.  Our waiter was really polite and knew the menu in and out.  The space was kind of plain but not messy or dirty, just plain.  My meal came and it was just so, so.  The pasta was heavy and on the harder side.  When we got desert, we ordered the famous tiramisu.  I give them props for trying to put a spin on a classic but again, they fell short.  Have you ever had a cremecicle ice creme bar?  That's what it tasted like.  Basically, it was orange flavored creme.  'Nough said.  I gave it three stars because the staff were great.  The food however, needs improvement for me to mosey on back.
author: Ryan B.

description: This was our second visit, this time to utilize the Groupon offer.  The food was very good.  I had the dungeness crab ravioli which was cooked perfectly. There were 6 large raviolis on the plate and each one was stuffed w/ crab. My starter was the grass fed beef carppacio.  The portion was quite large...two large pieces of beef rolled w/ salad greens.  I was expecting very thin slices on a plate...quite the opposite.  My husband started w/ the tuscan tomato soup and had the fettuccine w/ lamb ragu.  He was very pleased with his selections and commented on how well the pasta was cooked. The service was a bit slow to take our order and to give us our check but everything else in between was fine (they checked on us, cleared our table, etc).  I think some of the negative reviews from New Year's Eve was due to it being a very busy night but I think on a "regular" night, they are probably more  consistent.  They do try very hard to make your dining experience comfortable so I appreciate their efforts.  I still think this is a great place for the neighborhood.
author: Puff G.

description: Very European in feel, attitude, mood and food quality: excellent food prepared in-house (we shared the night's pasta special with a duck ragout and mushrooms, followed by a wonderful fish dish). Our server was outstanding: Mattia. Love him! Recommend for a dinner if you want to feel like you're back in Roma or Cinque Terre or Firenze. The Italian film projecting on the back wall (without sound) was a nice flourish. And they have house-made aperitifs, too. Loved every minute of it, and every delicious bite. Even the dessert was fabulous. LOVE THEM!
author: Emmabelle S.

description: Authentic Italian food served by warm kind people -- from the owner to the wait staff.  Good is great.  Go there now.
author: jim T.

description: Must give this place 5 stars!!  I enjoyed every moment of my experience at Poesia..Great food, fantastic service, excellent wine, friendly and unprentious atmosphere, decent price point, etc....Will definitely be going back (as soon as i find another awesome date to take, like the one i had on this particular visit..lol) Will definitely be recommending the place to friends and family..Would definitely rate this restaurant high on my, "must check out" list..
author: Samuel J.

description:
My husband and I tried Poesia last week. We had a delightful time. The food and service were superb. The only reason I'm giving them four stars instead of five is ambience. The restaurant had a film playing on a screen without sound, which didn't seem to make sense. And, one of the staff members kept coming by empty tables and obsessively realigning them. Making up for those minor problems, the restaurant is located on the second floor, so you get a view of all the cute Castro boys and some of the hill leading up Castro into the 20s, if you manage to wrangle a window seat. Arrive early or make reservations with a request for a window seat.
It's a great date place.
author: Justin J.

description: Glad there's a new place in the Castro.  Went on a friday.  Business was booming.  The food was really good.  I had the lamb chops and my friend had the pork, though the pork was a bit undercooked.  A big problem was that they seated us 20 minutes after our reservation time.  The place seemed somewhat chaotic.  The staff is friendly enough but just a bit unpolished...so the 3 stars.  But worth a visit.
author: Eric C.

description: It's a little pricey, but worth it. The food is great, the service is friendly and you can linger a while.
author: Anita S.

description: Barista is from the homeland, explaining the reason why a short finish red would be good to pair with a good cheese, while the long finish red he recommended for our bar table sipping. That is the measure of a true-blue added value that plainly differentiates one establishment from another - all are in the business, but some are meanwhile into the humanity and pleasure of it all
author: yelp -.

description: I ate here, yet again about a month ago with a good friend of mine (who happens to be Lilian) who hadn't been here. We didn't have a reservations, but fortunately were seated right away - and was served by none other than Francesco, the owner, who sounds like he had just arrived from Italy. This is my 3rd time (first two I was with another friend named also Lillian) since they opened, and my experience is always GREAT! The sardines appetizer is delicious - crispy and tasty - if you like sardines!! We also had the artichoke cakes - enjoyed that as well - creamy artichokes inside a crispy outer layer. My friend had the fillet mignon and I had the rack of lamb - we decided to share - and we really enjoyed them - cooked the way we ordered (medium rare); I had a glass of cabernet - paired well with the meat - if it was the house cabernet - that was enjoyable!! I suggest you make reservations. The place is small - but service is great, and the food - really delicious!
author: Jojo S.

description:
The venue is cute, cozy and in a good location.  The staff was friendly, welcoming and entertaining and the food was GREAT!  The eggplant parm is better than my mom's and hers is pretty darn good (sorry, mom).  

The only thing that I didn't love was the tiramisu.  I am a huge fan of tiramisu and this one was sort of lemon flavored.  A cool idea and not bad but I am just a huge fan of classic tiramisu so I was a little disappointed.  

All in all a great spot and a great meal, I highly recommend.
author: Marie N.

description:
I wish I could give Poesia more than three stars, really I do but the food was just not up to my expectations.

We ate here on a weekend night and luckily had a reservation - the place was super-packed.  And it didn't look like all Castro regulars, this place is drawing 'em in from far and wide in the city, by the looks of the crowd that night.

The staff was wonderful and accommodating (seating us even though not all of our group was there yet, keeping our glasses filled and stopping by to check on us throughout the night).  

The food...well, it wasn't bad and maybe my expectations were too high at the prospect of an authentic southern italian restaurant run by a young, cute southern italian guy!

The arancini and bacala crostini appetizers were good (note:  only order the bacala crostini if you like fishy and salty food - the waiter made it a point to call this out so you know that someone complained about it.  Me, I loved it!).  The entrees were slightly disappointing.  I had the special pasta which was paccheri (think wide, fat rigatoni) with scallops and shitaki mushrooms.  The waiter said they drizzle the pasta with truffle oil but i couldn't taste any.  In fact, the pasta was super bland.  Having weaned myself off of excessive salt intake in the last year, I've retrained my palate to like things not so salty but even I had to add salt and pepper to this dish to give it flavor.  It was fine after the additions but, really, it's the job of the chef to properly season my food - especially pasta.  For the most part, my dining companions enjoyed their entrees - most after adding salt and pepper.  We didn't have dessert but I noticed that the desserts passing our tables looked really small (think two bon-bon sized dollops of chocolate mousse).

I'm not going to write Poesia off just yet but I won't hurry back either.  Perhaps with a bit of time, they'll have worked through any issues.

But they do make a highly recommended, stick-to-the-sides of the cup espresso!
author: Gelsomina L.

description: We saw this sweet place while walking in Castro -- it is quite simply a must try. Exceptional Italian food; full bar; excellent wines. The place is terrific - great atmosphere; small, but use of space is good, simple design, great color scheme and very relaxing. The staff really pampers - starting with owner Francesco who moved to SF from Calabria. He ensures every table has what they need and are enjoying themselves. Prices are VERY reasonable for such high quality. By the end of the night it felt like the whole room knew eachother and we were all  just relaxing for dinner at a friends place. Go here!
author: Kelly W.

description:
Don't believe the hype. 
We had an appetizer - mediocre at best. 
My pasta - same, kinda blah.
My companion's pasta - had to be canned sauce. but canned tomato sauce so bad that even chef boyardee wouldn't put his name on it. terrible. too bad because cute place.
author: S W.

description: I just came home after dinner and had to write this review.  The service was excellent.  I couldn't ask to be waited on more and at the same time be left alone to spend my meal with my girlfriend on our anniversary.  We ordered the specials: rack of lamb and swordfish.  They were perfect.  Both of us were content and ready  to leave and pay for our meal, but before we left the owner sent us a complimentary desert.  These people are really nice and I was happy to spend my time here.
author: mick H.

description: We booked a 9:30 seating.  However the restaurant had 2 parties of 8 seated just ahead of us so we knew we were in for a wait.  The host suggested the bar was open so we went for it had a fab martini  and after our wait became quite noticeable the bartender offered us comp champagne and when we still weren't seated he graciously comped our bar bill.  The host apologized for the delay. Once seated the wait staff was quite attentive, lots of Italian accents.  We enjoyed the atmosphere, dim lighting, quite charming with a Fellini Clown movie flickering on the wall.  The mussels were fresh and savory, soaked up the sauce with the bread. We got over the long wait.  The lamb shank with Fettuccine was tender and noodles were yum. The eggplant parmigiana melted in your mouth. Blood orange spritzer was refreshing.  Just before midnight they passed out party favors and hats and everyone was able to welcome in the new year.  A great restaurant for the Castro, makes you feel like your in Rome.
author: Kevin D.

description: New Years Eve, our first visit to Poesia, placed us amongst all the others waiting in their tiny lobby an hour or more after our confirmed reservation.  The restaurant's computer reservation screen faces the lobby allowing all to view their guest's names.  There is also on the screen  a table "map" where the table's color changes reflecting how many hours a table has been occupied.  A little too much information for a "nice" restaurant to not keep a little more private?   Our drinks were served after the wine, service scarce,  portions small.  A little less opportunistic over booking, a little more privacy on the reservation screen in the lobby and a revisit on the tiny portion size and this place's potential charm might show through.
author: David R.

description: Sweet little spot with wonderful food and handsome waiters. Great wine list. Wonderful specials. I love it.
author: Alicia J.

description:
Goodness...the reviews of this place seem to be all over the map!!! After three meals there over the course of a few months, I can see where many of the other reviewers' comments have merit, but overall I find it one of the better dining experiences in the Castro (although the competition is getting stiffer!) 
What do I like? The room is pleasant, with good lighting and nice artwork, and the classic Italian films silently playing on the wall are a nice touch. It's not overly loud, and the tables are decently spaced AND have tablecloths--both becoming a rarity in the new wave of SF restaurants.] 
The menu choices are limited and a bit peculiar, but everything I've had has been excellent. This isn't standard "Italian" fare, it seems to draw more from the regions of Italy that aren't always represented elsewhere. 
Service is...interesting. The waiters are all extremely friendly, very Italian, and often quite attractive (like Francesco, the owner/host.) However, they can be a bit ditsy as well. Last evening I ordered the special chicken breast entree, and was served the special pasta entree (lamb and porcini in a wonderful tomato sugo) instead. However, the minute I saw it I knew it was a keeper, and I devoured it all. A happy ending. The staff is extremely knowledgeable about the wine list, their recommendations are always spot-on. 
As for some of the other comments regarding prices ("higher than Boulevard!!") I'm not seeing this myself; methinks they may have run up the bill with cocktails and wine in addition to food. 
All in all, I like the place, and I'll keep going back until I have a reason not to.
author: Tom R.

description:
authentic Italian food!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 
no other place makes food this good!!!!! 
every dish was amazing and the hosts were nothing but professional and just made the experience awesome! and i like the fact that they play Italian movies from the 30's 40's 

i got nothing bad to say!
author: Steven T.

description: This place is fantastic.   Since a friend told me about it a year ago I have been 3 x and always leave happy having had good food, excellent service and pleasant staff.   If you haven't been here, you don't know what you are missing!
author: EM M.

description:
Very romantic setting. It looks like someone's living room but that just adds to the sense of intimacy. 

We had veal, past with greens and wine. Everything was great. Our waiter had that amazing ability to be attentive and respectful of privacy at the same time.
author: Nadezda K.

description: As good as it gets! As far as authentic Italian cuisine goes, this place hits the mark. With regional dishes from Calabria in the South, the food is mouthwatering. It has fast become my favorite restaurant with the Squid Ink Risotto with Scallops and the Grilled Sardines being my favorite appetizers!! The owner/manager Francesco and his staff are truly outstanding and friendly. Just the way you would expect from a family owned Italian eatery! Word has definitely gotten out and this place gets packed regularly but they always manage to squeeze us in and we never have to wait for our food longer than 20-30 minutes!! These guys are amazing! Bellisimo!
author: Jim S.

description: Due to a hectic schedule, I kept postponing my reservation till finally got to it!  My hubby, daughter and I celebrated our bdays.  It certainly was worth the wait!  Haven't been to this neighborhood and was pleasantly surprised to find this awesome resto (via Groupon)!  Indeed, food was very tasty (sea bass, risotto w/ squid ink, beet salad, antipasto misto, bacala, fetuccine, gelato and mousse); service was great!  Ambiance was warm/cozy...liked the movie on the wall, too!
author: M C.

description:
Poesia is an average Italian restaurant offering decent food, standard prices, and passable service. Everything about this restaurant is sort of just okay. It's kind of disappointing because Poesia is located in such a lively district. The entrance of the restaurant is cute. It's sort of hidden because you have to walk up some stairs to get to the front entrance. The restaurant + bar is small and was pretty crowded. The decor isn't very fancy... it's just simple. The service was okay. They were attentive and checked back to see if we had any questions about their menu. Prices were standard (check below for a sample).

For starters, Alexander C., Eric T., and I shared the artichoke cake ($12) and the sardines appetizer ($13). The artichoke cake was bland. I expected it to be crispy but it was soft and mushy. I hoped for chunks of artichoke hearts but it basically had a blended consistency. The sardines were pretty good. They weren't too salty nor too fishy. I had the beet + goat cheese salad ($9) and it was eh, normal. The portion looked tiny because it was arranged in a neat pile in the middle, but there was definitely a lot of golden and red beets. I had some of my boyfriend's squid ink risotto ($23) and I liked it a lot. I love cheeese and it was just the right amount of cheesy.  However, my boyfriend thought it was way too cheesy. I tried some of my other friends' dishes... the pasta special (homemade bowtie pasta + filet mignon) and the rack of lamb. All of these dishes were pretty good, but didn't excite my taste buds enough. We were curious about the chocolate mousse because it was made with rock salt, chili powder, and EVOO, but we were pretty full. I don't think I would have been gutsy enough anyway. 

I hoped this was helpful. I wasn't too enthusiastic about Poesia but it is worth a try. Oh, beware of tourists who do not lock the bathroom door. Within a span of 2 minutes, two embarrassing and horrifying incidents of accidental peeping toms occurred. : X
author: Phoi B.

description: Consistently great food and service. The manager is always friendly and makes appropriate wine selections. The Ribeye was amazing and tasted more like a fine fillet. The Lamb rack was cooked to perfection and of the 3 desserts we tried our favorite was the Tiramisu!
author: R J.

description:
Loved it!
Everything we ordered was delicious.
The tomato soup, better than my mom's.
And the canoli,  mmm mmm!
author: Cate M.

description: this place is cuuuute. it has really good service here too. the eggplant par was ok not as great as the other reviewers have said but decent. i however did like hte sea bass and orecchiette. it was delish! the artichoke appetizer was pretty good too. the gnocchi was not as dense as i thought it would be but it did taste a bit like watermelon to me. oh well. the pork rib pasta has an odd consistency that i'm not sure i liked...ehh. but it was a good dinner overall.
author: Jackie D.

description: A lovely, lovely place to dine.  Amazingly delicious food, beautiful and unique setting, and just really outstanding service.  We had a beautiful meal there.  Really lovely for a romantic meal, or a meal with friends.  Just a class act all the way.
author: Sienna L.

description: Everything was very good, but the homemade pastas were fantastic.  I had the pasta with pork ribs and it was amazing.  My wife really liked the mussel soup special (I won't touch the stuff, so we'll have to take her word for it.)
author: Brian C.

description: one experience and one opinion. i tried to place a reservation and the host asked for my last name. i spelled it out and his response in an ugly tone was "Yeah. you are going to have to slow it down". told the staff member to forget it and hung up. if the host is rude that is a signal for me.
author: John S.

description: My love of italian food is revived!!! I was really impressed with everything, and it wasn't just because i was hungry, honest, i swear.  Was here for the soft-opening, and will definitely be back.  First, on arriving we passed it up because it's in what looks like an old victorian house with the entry at the top of a tall staircase that takes you above the regular stores.  I guess there was another restaurant here before (from what i heard), but you'd never know, because it is such a warm and cozy and clean dining space that makes you feel like you are at a friends super dining gala event.  The staff are wonderfully friendly and attentive, very laid back in a lively, energetic, competent way.  The food is just great.  Presentation is gorgeous and simple.  It's hard to say what my favorite is, but most memorable is the arancita - risotta and mozzarella balls, deep fried but not gross and greasy at all.  Light and fluffy with a smokey flavor.  The seafood salad was great, came with a dollop of fennel and carrot shaving salad, and perfectly cooked (and flavored) scallops, shrimp and mussels.  The seafood gnocchi with asparagus and saffron was great, but i actually think the plain old spaghetti was even better.  Light sauce but sooooo much flavor!  The chocolate mousse made with olive oil and with sea salt sprinkled on top is a must try because it's just plain great.  All in all, even though this was a last minute splurge of a Thursday night (splurge as in not regarding money but regarding my much more needed and ever diminishing loss of sleep before an intense early Friday workday), It was a well worth it time and fun, with friends and a great new, hardworking and well deserving restaurant peeps.
author: Today Y.

description: So I'm not one to write a yelp review and  can usually find more positives then negatives to say about a place/experience but felt the need to write about our experience at poesia last night. We dined here on Christmas last night, chose this place of the 70 something places that were open in SF because it got such great reviews and looked like a fun atmosphere and we were wanting Italian! People were kind from the minute we walked in the door, atmosphere was great with old christmas films projected onto the wall. but food was terrible. we ordered the mahi mahi with clams and mussels in a reduced tomatoe sauce. The whole meal was grindy with sand in it and pretty flavorless. We also got apps of the butter leaf lettuce and an eggplant dish which were both nothing special .They did have a guest chef on hand, maybe not the best idea on a special occasion like Christmas? Although everyone was very nice i was shocked that after a $120 meal not one person asked us how everything was. I'm not one to cause a scene but felt after how much we spent on this meal and for the special occasion that they should know how the food taste that they are serving. I was  ready and eager to tell them in a nice way that they had served us very sandy and tastless food but when they never asked us and were quick with us at the end of the meal it didnt give much chance. I'm pretty sure they knew though that that had served us very tasteless food when they brought us over a desert for free and told us it was on them. An off night perhaps because they got great reviews?
author: Jane C.

description:
the sirloin i had was phenomenal!  cooked to the right extent (middle rare).  tender and juicy!  
overall a great experience.  the wine list was a bit on the pricier side though.
author: Samuel N.

description: Absolutely, hands down the best Italian food I've ever had.  Really quaint place, great ambiance.  I had a persimmon chili martini, it was very unique and delicious.  Started w/ the fried artichoke w/ mozzarella cheese.  Amazing.  I had the eggplant parm and my boyfriend had the pork ribs pasta dish.  It was so good I almost died.  No joke.  For dessert, the canoli, which they make to order.  It was heaven.  The only bummer is we finally found an amazing Italian restaurant and it's 400 miles from home.  Can't wait to go back!
author: D T.

description: Lovely atmosphere in a converted Victorian house in the CASTRO...memorable food (antipasti and insalata were more memorable than pasta dishes)... the gnocchi starter was citrusy, light and fresh... fennel salad with sliced green apples, arugula and cheese was crisp and simply yummy...the orrechiete pasta (vegetarian) was unique but a little too rich ...the pasta with pork rib was just ok...the dark chocolate cloud was different and rich... they were playing La Dolce Vita on a blank wall ... great ambiance. Recommended for a date night. =)
author: J T.

description: Excellent atmosphere, excellent food, and excellent service.  Nuf said.
author: Garrett H.

description: An amazing addition to the neighborhood. Francesco, the owner, is a sweetheart and extremely knowledgeable. Every dinner at Poesia has been a delight. It's a great place for friends, family and dates.  The food and wine selections pair beautifully - almost too beautifully! Good thing I live just a few blocks away!
author: Tina L.

description: It's always a shame to see a once fine restaurant lose its way, but unfortunately Poesia has gone the way of other places before it.   Food which was once creative and flavorful is now boring and bland.  Formerly friendly service has been replaced by servers too rushed to care.   I suspect Poesia may hold on for a while, given the relative lack of competition in the Castro, but this diner will not be wasting his money at this mediocre place again.
author: James S.

description: I really enjoyed my evening at Poesia and look forward to going back.  Keep in mind I live just 2 blocks away...not sure how in love I would be if I had to travel across town.  However the next time I will stick to the pastas only as the entrees.  They make their own pasta and the dishes are very unique...we had the pasta with the duck...one of the better pasta dishes I've ever had.  Be prepared to spend $20+ on their pasta entrees which in my opinion makes the frequent visits to this place harder to stomach.  We also ordered the pork tenderloin which was good but overcooked.  Which is funny because other reviewers have complained about their meat being undercooked, ah well.  Guess you need to specify these things.  The place was packed and buzzing on a Saturday night and they did a great job moving the service along.  Dig the atmosphere...cozy and fancy with a movie projected on the wall to give it a modern feel.  It's nice to go to a spot that isn't trying to be so trendy and modern.  Oh and don't skip the burrata to start...just don't...I'd go back for just that dish alone.
author: Piper B.

description: This place is amazing!  The atmosphere is quaint and comfortable.  The staff are friendly and make you feel at home.  The food is delicious.  I had a cod fish appetizer that was amazing, both the tomato and chick pea soup were delicious, and I loved the Orecchiette al Forno!  And, you have to try the chocolate mousse.  It has rock salt on top and is drizzled with olive oil.  The Castro was in need of a nice sit down restaurant.  Thank you Poesia.
author: genea s.

description: Really, really great food! This is the Italian restaurant I'd been looking for for years. Lots of vegetarian options. Wonderful food and wait staff. I can't wait to go back.
author: Michelle M.

description: I rarely return to any restaurant twice, particularly Italian restaurants in California.  As a Philadelphian, I find that few here measure up to the ones in South Philly.  Poesia is so super that I have broken this habit and been back multiple times.  The homemade pasta, filet, soups and desserts are fabulous.  Very difficult to find a good canoli or tartuffo here and I found them both at Poesia!!  Waitstaff is very knowledgeable and friendly.  Can't wait to bring my Philly-Italian friends.
author: Christina W.

description: We had a fabulous experience at Poesia last night.  We had the special appetizer of fresh sardines, the eggplant parmesan and the ravioli.  All were wonderful.  We had great service -- couldn't be better.  I think this is my new favorite restaurant!
author: laurel t.

description: Loved it. Warm and friendly staff and environment. Great food. Get the chocolate mousse. It's incredible.
author: valerie p.

description: This is truly a dynamite restaurant.  I spent my entire career in the food industry and my wife and I love to eat out.  Italian is our favorite cuisine.  This place was a sheer delight.  The couple we ate with are very finicky and they loved Poesia as well.  The service was OUTSTANDING.  They take their business seriously, know their food and were delightful.  The Carpaccio Rolatini(sp.?) Appetizer was excellent and quite  a large portion.  The seafood stew was delicious, far better than your pedestrian Cioppino and 3 of us  had a great fresh made- pasta with a pork ragu.  This place is a real keeper.
author: Anthony G.

description: I have been to Poesia for dinner three times, and it has been consistently wonderful.  If you are looking for authentic Italian food in a cozy environment I highly recommend Poesia.  The food is delicious and the service is great.  The appetizers are particularly amazing.  There is one dish with a tuna spread that I have gotten every time I have gone YUMMY. This is not your typical North Beach Italian Restaurant....so much better
author: susie a.

description: we celebrated a special occasion here. great food, wine & service. the owner & waiters gave us lots of special attention. we had the window table which overlooks the view of 18th street & people watching. very classy decor, clean & cool old Italian movies. worth every $ penny. we enjoyed a yummy Napa Chardonnay, beef appetizer, orechiette & fettuccine pasta, followed by zeppolle for dessert. Priceless.
author: peaches w.
